intro: Lomatogonium bellum, commonly known as the silverleaf lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant features silvery-gray foliage with deeply lobed leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Lomatogonium bellum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
